messages.author: arv
messages.text: Not really an Array. It is a static NodeList

messages.author: SeRya
messages.text:
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> This change seems unrelated.

It is related change. While recreating splitters on fly works fine with mouse events there are sporadic troubles with touch dragging. Apparently it is because touch is bound to a DOM node. If the node removed form the tree the touch stops.

messages.author: SeRya
messages.text:
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> Not really an Array. It is a static NodeList
It actually both.

messages.author: SeRya
messages.text:
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> This seems unrelated

Related (as described above).

messages.author: SeRya
messages.text:
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> goting again?

Removed.

messages.author: arv
messages.text: Can we remove handleMouseUp_, handleTouchEnd_ and handleTouchCancel_ and just use endDrag_ as the event handler?

messages.author: SeRya
messages.text:
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> This should never happen.

Removed.

messages.author: SeRya
messages.text:
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> What does goting mean? =P

It was unnecessary. Removed.

messages.author: SeRya
messages.text:
On 2012/06/15 16:21:07, arv wrote:
> Can we remove handleMouseUp_, handleTouchEnd_ and handleTouchCancel_ and just
> use endDrag_ as the event handler?

Done.
